meanings.definition: To move with quick, light, flapping motions.
meanings.sent1: The butterfly flutters gracefully in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The bird flutters its wings as it takes off.
meanings.sent3: The paper flutters in the breeze, trying to escape.
meanings.sent4: Her heart flutters with excitement as she sees him.
meanings.sent5: The flag flutters proudly in the wind.

meanings.definition: A state of nervous excitement or agitation.
meanings.sent1: She felt flutters in her stomach before the big test.
meanings.sent2: The unexpected news caused flutters among the crowd.
meanings.sent3: The flutters of anticipation made her jittery.
meanings.sent4: The flutters of anxiety kept her up at night.
meanings.sent5: His flutters of fear were visible in his trembling hands.

meanings.definition: A series of rapid, irregular movements.
meanings.sent1: The sudden flutters of the curtains startled her.
meanings.sent2: The flutters of the leaves in the wind created a soothing sound.
meanings.sent3: The flutters of the squirrel's tail caught her attention.
meanings.sent4: The flutters of the fish in the pond were mesmerizing.
meanings.sent5: The flutters of the fireflies lit up the night sky.
